text: Carving is the foundation of good snowboarding.
It's all about edge control and weight distribution.
Start on a gentle slope to practice.
Shift your weight to your toes for a toeside carve.
You should feel the edge biting into the snow.
Keep your body aligned over the board.
For heelside, shift your weight back to your heels.
Practice linking these turns together smoothly.
The key is to be patient and let the board do the work.
